meanings.definition: The state or quality of being solid.
meanings.sent1: The solidness of the rock made it difficult to break.
meanings.sent2: The table's solidness was evident in its weight and sturdiness.
meanings.sent3: The solidness of the ice cream cone made it impossible to eat without making a mess.
meanings.sent4: Her argument lacked solidness, crumbling under the weight of scrutiny.
meanings.sent5: The solidness of the ground beneath their feet gave them a sense of security.

meanings.definition: The property of having a firm and stable structure.
meanings.sent1: The solidness of the building withstood the strong winds of the storm.
meanings.sent2: The solidness of the bridge reassured the travelers of its safety.
meanings.sent3: The solidness of the jenga tower surprised everyone when it didn't collapse.
meanings.sent4: The solidness of the foundation was crucial for the stability of the entire structure.
meanings.sent5: The solidness of the tree trunk provided a sturdy base for the treehouse.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being reliable or dependable.
meanings.sent1: His solidness as a friend was evident in his unwavering support.
meanings.sent2: The solidness of her promises gave me confidence in her abilities.
meanings.sent3: The solidness of the old car surprised everyone when it started on the first try.
meanings.sent4: The solidness of the company's reputation attracted many loyal customers.
meanings.sent5: The solidness of the lock ensured the safety of the valuable items inside.
